com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class DocumentAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentAction

  • public abstract class DocumentAction
extends Object
    A DocumentAction performs some operation to modify a document, without creating new documents. It is recommended that DocumentOperation (where the performOperation message simply returns null to create 0 documents) be used in most cases.

    A plugin may provide a set of actions via GeneiousPlugin.getDocumentActions().

    • Method Detail

      • getActionOptions

        public abstract GeneiousActionOptions getActionOptions()
        Get options for action. This contains all the important information including name, description, icon, where the action is displayed in the interface etc.
        Returns:
        action options, cannot be null

      • getHelp

        public abstract String getHelp()
        Help for this action in the form of HTML or plain text. This should give a brief description of any selection signatures this action can act on and what the effect is. See some of the standard operations in Geneious for examples (eg. Alignment).

        This text is displayed when the user tries to perform the action on documents which do not match the selection signature or if the user clicks the help button in the action's options panel.

        May return null.

        Returns:
        the help

      • actionPerformed

        public abstract void actionPerformed(AnnotatedPluginDocument[] documents)
        Perform a document action.

        Note: The action will be run in a non AWT thread. If you need to perform user interface interaction (for example prompting for user input) then you need to place this inside a ThreadUtilities.invokeAndWait() or a SwingUtilities.invokeLater() function call.

        WARNING: Geneious may call this function multiple times simultaneously. Therefore, any implementation should not store its internal state within instance fields.

        Parameters:
        documents - to operate on.

      • getSelectionSignatures

        public abstract DocumentSelectionSignature[] getSelectionSignatures()
        Specifies the document(s) this action is available for.

        Return array containing new DocumentSelectionSignature(PluginDocument.class, 0, Integer.MAX_VALUE) to have it enabled when at least one document of any type is selected.

        Returns:
        DocumentSelectionSignatures applicable signatures. Cannot be null. An empty array means always enabled.
